rg.blockSwapper.text10: STEP 2: On top of redstone torch at center place a sticky piston facing upward and then a block in front of it and place a block in its either left or right side of sticky piston's arm. These two blocks which will swap when input is trigger.
rg.blockSwapper.text11: STEP 3: In both side place a piston, both are facing at sticky piston's arm.
rg.blockSwapper.text12: STEP 4: A block in front of sticky piston, place another block in its side where input is, then a button in it. Then beneath this block place a sticky piston facing downward and then a redstone block.
rg.blockSwapper.text13: STEP 5: You can now cover the redstone components.
rg.hiddenChest.text0: Hidden Chest is a redstone mechanism that will hide your chest and you can reveal in just one click. You can use this to protect your items and prevent anyone accessing your chest.
rg.hiddenChest.text1: In this tutorial I will use gold block in building this mechanism that represents to any opaque block and quartz of block represent as floor.
rg.hiddenChest.text2: STEP 1: Place 2 sticky piston facing upward and then chest on top of it then block of your choice for floor in the left side then a regular piston facing to block and another piston on the right side 1 block away from chest.
rg.hiddenChest.text3: STEP 2: At the back of lower piston place a block then a redstone torch attached to it and next a block on top of redstone torch and another redstone torch attached to it.
rg.hiddenChest.text4: STEP 3: Place a block 1 block below from regular piston then a redstone dust following with repeaters like shown in the picture. This is a piston extender where redstone torch at the back is your input.
rg.hiddenChest.text5: STEP 4: On the right side build like what shown in the picture a redstone dust placed next to repeater will be the input for extender. The two comparator in reversed direction uses to make redstone current stays a bit longer than usual.
rg.hiddenChest.text6: STEP 5: At the back, place a redstone torch attached to a block where comparator is facing then a redstone dust connected to a redstone torch. This will extend the extender.
rg.hiddenChest.text7: STEP 6: Build like what shown in the picture, the repeater has only 1 tick. This wiring is connected to left piston.
rg.hiddenChest.text8: STEP 7: Going back to the front, place an observer facing down to the redstone dust then repeater on top of it going to redstone torch at the back.
rg.hiddenChest.text9: STEP 8: This repeater on top is the input, now build a T-flip Flop here after placing item on upper dropper it will retract chest and swap to floor block.
rg.hiddenChest.text10: STEP 9: That block of quartz is your ground floor level, now cover them with your chosen blocks for floor.
rg.hiddenChest.text11: The input is the T-Flip Flop, place in either side of upper dropper a repeater facing to it and that is your input, connect your input in your chosen placed.
rg.mobTraps.text0: Traps are a common mechanism in Survival Multiplayer built by players to kill other players or mobs automatically. The following is a list of traps for mobs with a short tutorial that often assumes the reader has a working understanding of the basic concepts required to build the traps.
rg.mobTraps.text1: This trap will automatically lock or stuck mob in a door cage when they step on.
rg.mobTraps.text2: To build this simply place pressure plates on ground and place 4 iron doors in a spiral pattern around the pressure plate.
rg.mobTraps.text3: Any mob won't get out and stucked in area when step on the area where trap is, you can also lure some mobs to chase them alive.
rg.mobTraps.text4: STEP 1: Dig an outline of square or rectangular shape with 1 block depth. Don't dig a block in corner.
rg.mobTraps.text5: STEP 2: Place piston facing upward in all hole.
rg.mobTraps.text6: STEP 3: Place a pressure plates at inner side of pistons.
rg.mobTraps.text7: STEP 4: Place a slabs or blocks in top of all pressure plates with 1 block gap from pressure plates.
rg.mobTraps.text8: If mob get inside of this area they will never get out because of pressure plate make piston to extend and block their way out.
rg.singleuseTraps.text0: Traps are a common mechanism in Survival Multiplayer built by players to kill other players or mobs automatically. The following is a list of traps that can be use one time only with a short tutorial that often assumes the reader has a working understanding of the basic concepts required to build the traps.
rg.singleuseTraps.text1: This traps will blown up with tnt whose anyone walk or go inside the house. Build it in a house with iron door that use pressure plate to open door.
rg.singleuseTraps.text2: Players won't think it's a trap they will think that pressure plates is use for opening iron door, that's why iron door is required for this.
rg.singleuseTraps.text3: Place a TNT under the block where pressure plate is placed, you can place how many TNT you want but make sure all will explode.
rg.singleuseTraps.text4: This trap will blown up a player who will mine an ore. If ore is completely mined TNT will activate.
rg.singleuseTraps.text5: STEP 1: Find a cave you want to build this.
rg.singleuseTraps.text6: STEP 2: Place ore (i.e diamond ore), replace it in any stone.
rg.singleuseTraps.text7: STEP 3: At the back of ore place a redstone torch attached to ore.
rg.singleuseTraps.text8: STEP 4: Connect a redstone torch to your output use another redstone torch to invert signal, your output should be off.
rg.singleuseTraps.text9: STEP 5: Now place TNT connected at output under the ground where a player will stand when mining ore.
rg.singleuseTraps.text10: STEP 6: Cover the TNT and redstone component with stones, keep it look like naturally remove torches so player will think that there's no one was here.
rg.singleuseTraps.text11: This trap will blown anyone who will eat a cake.
rg.singleuseTraps.text12: STEP 1: Dig a hole in ground any length and width and at least 2 block depth.
rg.singleuseTraps.text13: STEP 2: Fill a hole with TNT, you can place TNT as many as you want.
rg.singleuseTraps.text14: STEP 3: Place a redstone dust in top of tnt then on top it place a block for a cake.
rg.singleuseTraps.text15: STEP 4: Now build this contraption, make sure the repeater is the last thing you place to prevent observer sending signals to repeater and activate TNT.
rg.singleuseTraps.text16: STEP 5: Cover the tnt with a block for floor.
rg.singleuseTraps.text17: STEP 6: Build a wall to cover redstone components.
rg.multiuseTraps.text0: Traps are a common mechanism in Survival Multiplayer built by players to kill other players or mobs automatically. The following is a list of basic traps that can be use many times with a short tutorial that often assumes the reader has a working understanding of the basic concepts required to build the trap.
rg.multiuseTraps.text1: In this trap any player who open a chest will fell down in lava.
rg.multiuseTraps.text2: STEP 1: Dig down a hole 2 width 3 length and 3 depth.
rg.multiuseTraps.text3: STEP 2: On both side of hole dig another 2 x 3 hole and 1 block depth.
rg.multiuseTraps.text4: STEP 3: Place a sticky pistons facing at center in both of sides, then a block. And change a block at the end.
rg.multiuseTraps.text5: STEP 4: Place a trapped chest at the end of hole and place redstone dust one block depth behind a chest. Then repeater facing away at redstone dust then redstone torch on top of block where repeater is facing.
rg.multiuseTraps.text6: STEP 5: Pour a hole with lava. Here player will fall when chest is open.
rg.multiuseTraps.text7: STEP 6: Connect redstone torch to all sticky pistons with redstone dust.
rg.multiuseTraps.text8: STEP 7: Cover the redstone components. Make sure nothing is visible.
rg.autoLights.text0: The lamp post's light is OFF during the day and turns ON when night.
rg.autoLights.text1: To build this, place a fence how high you want (cobblestone wall at bottom is optional) then redstone lamp at the top, at top of redstone lamp place a daylight sensor and switch to night mode, and then place a trapdoor in all side of redstone lamp and close them.
rg.autoCooker.text0: Auto-Cooker is a mechanisms that will automatically cook or smelt item and stored on chest after it was cooked/smelted. If stack of item is done it will automatically take another stack items on chest and bring it on furnace to cook/smelt. If furnace runs out of fuel it will automatically take another from chest.
rg.autoCooker.text1: STEP 1: Place a large chest and place a hopper behind it, connected to chest.
rg.autoCooker.text2: STEP 2: On top of hoppers place a furnace and then on side of furnace place a hopper in it's side and on top in both of furnace.
rg.autoCooker.text3: STEP 3: On the top of all hoppers place a chests.
rg.autoCooker.text4: STEP 4: Cover it and make only furnaces and chests are visible. You can design if you want.
rg.autoCooker.text5: Now your auto-cooker mechanism is done. Below, here how it use.
rg.autoCooker.text6: TOP CHEST: Here are all items you want to cooked or smelt.
rg.autoCooker.text7: SIDE CHEST: Put here your fuels for furnace.
rg.autoCooker.text8: BOTTOM CHEST: If items was cooked/smelted it will automatically store here.
rg.autoCooker.text9: §bVariation§r: You can replace furnace with smoker or blast furnace depend on what you need for fast cooking or smelting.
rg.autoFarm.text0: Automatic farm can automatically harvest crops and collect, crops's fruit (melon and pumpkin), can automatically cut sugarcane that make your work easier and faster.
rg.autoFarm.text1: This farm will automatically cut a sugar cane when it reach a 3 block high.
rg.autoFarm.text2: This farm is very easy to build, just build what shown in the picture below.
rg.autoFarm.text3: This is stackable you can build another directly next to other copies of itself to expand it.
rg.autoFarm.text4: This is a semi-automatic farm. If crops is ready to harvest click button and it will automatically harvest and collect.
rg.autoFarm.text5: STEP 1: Build two 8 x 4 dirt with 1 block gap at center.
rg.autoFarm.text6: STEP 2: On either side dig a 1 block depth and place redstone dust along in hole with 1 repeater to extend the current of a redstone dust.
rg.autoFarm.text7: STEP 3: Cover it with blocks. And build a wall for your farm.
rg.autoFarm.text8: STEP 4: At the end place a dispenser and put one water bucket inside of each dispenser.
rg.autoFarm.text9: STEP 5: Continue building wall and design your farm.
rg.autoFarm.text10: STEP 6: At the back place a repeater facing at dispenser then redstone dust.
rg.autoFarm.text11: Make sure it's connected from your output.
rg.autoFarm.text12: STEP 7: Place a chest at center 1 block away.
rg.autoFarm.text13: STEP 8: Place a hopper behind the chest connected to it.
rg.autoFarm.text14: STEP 9: Place a hopper in all front of dirt and connected all at center hopper, do it in both side.
rg.autoFarm.text15: STEP 10: Pour hole a water in the center.
rg.autoFarm.text16: STEP 11: Till the dirt with hoe to make a farm plot.
rg.autoFarm.text17: STEP 12: Place a button in your input.
rg.autoFarm.text18: STEP 13: Cover the water at center with slabs or any solid blocks to prevent crops stucked in this water.
rg.autoFarm.text19: STEP 14: Build awall in front to prevent crops from falling.
rg.autoFarm.text20: You can now plant a crops you can plant wheat, carrot, potato or betroot.
rg.autoFarm.text21: If crops is ready to harvest click button, then crops will automatically harvest and collect, all will stored at chest.
rg.autoFarm.text22: Click the button again to make dispenser get water and you can plant crops again.
rg.autoFarm.text23: This farm will automatically harvest melon instead of manually breaking them all one by one. By clicking button you can harvest them automatically and ready to collect.
rg.autoFarm.text24: STEP 1: Make a water cannal (any length) and till its two side with hoe.
rg.autoFarm.text25: STEP 2: Dig the next two side with 2 block depth.
rg.autoFarm.text26: STEP 3: Place a sticky pistons facing upward in the hole.
rg.autoFarm.text27: STEP 4: Cover the pistons with dirt.
rg.autoFarm.text28: STEP 5: Dig the next side with 1 block depth, extend 1 block in front and then place a redstone dust.
rg.autoFarm.text29: STEP 6: Cover the redstone dust with block and build a wall. And place two button in both side of wall.
rg.autoFarm.text30: STEP 7: Place a wall, slabs or any other blocks in front of farm plot to prevent melon/pumpkin to bear fruit there.
rg.autoFarm.text31: STEP 8: Now plant a melon/pumpkin seeds in all farm plot.
rg.autoFarm.text32: If crops bear fruits and ready to harvest click the button to automatically harvest them all.
rg.autoRefillerCauldron.text0: This mechanism will automatically refill cauldron with water when emptied (will become full if not full) with just one click. You can get unlimited water from cauldron.
rg.autoRefillerCauldron.text1: STEP 1: Build a simple horizontal double piston extender like shown in picture with cauldron in front of piston.
rg.autoRefillerCauldron.text2: STEP 2: Build a wall in front of it and leave a hole in front of cauldron.
rg.autoRefillerCauldron.text3: STEP 3: At the back, place a blocks that use to hold water at top of cauldron, then pour it a water.
rg.autoRefillerCauldron.text4: STEP 4: Place a redstone torch to power the extender, this will push out the cauldron in wall.
rg.autoRefillerCauldron.text5: STEP 5: Behind where redstone torch is placed, place a button. You can optionally replace block where button is placed with different block for aesthetic design.
rg.keycardLock.text0: A keycard lock is a lock that required a right keycard to control the door. A paper is use as your keycard, it should need to insert in order to control the door, only your keycard is accepted to control the door.
rg.keycardLock.text1: STEP 1: Dig a hole with 2 width, 4 length and 2 block depth.
rg.keycardLock.text2: STEP 2: Place a redstone dust at end and repeater facing to a block and place redstone torch attached to block.
rg.keycardLock.text3: STEP 3: Now on top of redstone torch place a block and then an iron door.
rg.keycardLock.text4: STEP 4: Build a wall and leave 1 block hole.
rg.keycardLock.text5: STEP 5: At the hole place a dropper facing inside. (Picture below is in inside view)
rg.keycardLock.text6: STEP 6: Place a hopper facing to a dropper.
rg.keycardLock.text7: STEP 7: Place a comparator facing away from hopper and build what shown in picture.
rg.keycardLock.text8: The hopper is powered by redstone torch, this will deactivate a hopper (stop transferring item).
rg.keycardLock.text9: STEP 8: Get four 64x stackable items then renamed them using anvil into random name, each need a different names.
rg.keycardLock.text10: STEP 9: After you named them all place it in slot of hopper, leave the first slot.
rg.keycardLock.text11: STEP 10: Get 19 pieces of paper and also renamed them using anvil but all papers should have same name. Renamed the paper in a word you want, this is like your password.
rg.keycardLock.text12: STEP 11: Place all papers you renamed in first slot of hopper. This should transfer 1 item into dropper, get that paper in dropper and that is your keycard.
rg.keycardLock.text13: The comparator will measure the block state of hopper, a four 64x stackable item and 19 pieces of paper a total of 23 items (all are 64x stackable items) is enough to give power level 2. If power level 2 is reached the repeater will powered causing the redstone torch to OFF and unpowered the hopper so hoper will transfer item. Then after one item is transferred, its now only have a total of 22 items, it is not enough to give power level 2 so the redstone torch will ON again and stop hopper from transferring items. That's how it should work!
rg.keycardLock.note0: §oNote: The four items that was renamed into random letters is used to make other item can't transfer into hopper because of hopper is full. You renamed it into random letters to make other item like this won't stack in same slot, basically it is use to block other items to transfer in hopper.
rg.keycardLock.text14: STEP 12: At outside place a button on dropper, here on dropper will you insert your keycard to control door.
rg.keycardLock.text15: STEP 13: Place a redstone dust connected to a redstone torch and place a redstone torch attach to a block where redstone dust is placed (it's need to invert signal) next to it place repeater and dig 2 block in front of repeater.
rg.keycardLock.text16: STEP 14: On this hole build Grizdale's T-Flip Flop, place a dropper facing upward and a hopper connected to dropper. Then put one item in dropper, any kind of item is allow.
rg.keycardLock.text17: STEP 15: Place another dropper on top of first dropper then a comparator facing away from dispenser.
rg.keycardLock.text18: STEP 16: Place a block in front of comparator and connect the output of T-Flip Flop into door.
rg.keycardLock.text19: STEP 17: Build a wall and place a button you can make block differ in wall where button is place, this is use to control door inside.
rg.keycardLock.text20: STEP 18: At the back place 2 repeater and place a repeater in side of dropper facing to it. It uses a repeater to prevent redstone dust to power.
rg.keycardLock.text21: STEP 19: Place a block in top of comparator and in it's side to connect the two repeaters to repeater facing in dropper.
rg.keycardLock.text22: STEP 20: Your keycard door lock is done, now cover the floor.
rg.keycardLock.text23: To use it, at outside open a dropper and insert your keycard then click the button to control the door while your keycard is inside the dropper you can close and open the door you can't also close the door if keycard is not there. At inside the button there you can control the door to open and close. After you open the door don't forget to get your keycard indside the dropper before you enter.
rg.keycardLock.note1: §oNOTE: If some players know the name of your paper they can make another paper to renamed, the same to the name you made and they can use it to your keycard door lock. So keep your paper safe and private don't let other knew it.§r
rg.password.text0: Lever Passcode needs a specific combinations of input in order to trigger the output (ONLY Gate). This work exactly same as ONLY Gate (see Logic Gates section) but have more inputs. You can use it on your door to forbid anyone to enter.
rg.password.text1: STEP 1: Build 8 x 4 wall and make inner block different from the outer, for aesthetic design. That is optional the important is you build a wall.
rg.password.text2: STEP 2: Now place a levers at inner part (6 x 2). Then set up any combination you like.
rg.password.text3: STEP 3: At the back, place a redstone torch in all blocks where levers are placed.
rg.password.text4: Let's use 2 different color to make you easily understand it.
rg.password.text5: -§cRed§r: All components place here has to be changed in order to change the password. The components that placed here depend on the combination you set.
rg.password.text6: -§aLime§r: All components place here doesn't need to change once it placed.
rg.password.text7: STEP 4: At the top of higher redstone torch place a row of red blocks, then another 2 row of red blocks diagonally going down. And the lastly place a row of red blocks 1 block away below the 3rd row of red block above.
rg.password.text8: STEP 5: Now for the lime block, place a row of lime blocks like shown in picture.
rg.password.text9: STEP 6: Place a redstone dust in top row and bottom row of lime blocks.
rg.password.text10: STEP 7: At the inner lime blocks place a repeater facing to the red block.
rg.password.text11: STEP 8: Connect the redstone dust like shown in picture.
rg.password.text12: Now for setting up the password on top.
rg.password.text13: STEP 9: Place a repeater directly behind in all of the ON levers at the top of 2nd row of red blocks.
rg.password.text14: STEP 10: Place a redstone torch in all OFF levers attached to a 1st row of red blocks.
rg.password.text15: Now for setting up the password at the bottom.
rg.password.text16: STEP 11: Again in all OFF levers place a redstone torch attached to a 3rd row of red blocks.
rg.password.text17: STEP 12: In all ON levers place a redstone dust on top of 4th row of red blocks.
rg.password.text18: Your done in setting up the password, let's head with the door.
rg.password.text19: STEP 13: In the side dig a hole like shown in the picture with 2 block depth, 2 width and the length is from lime wool going to the wall.
rg.password.text20: STEP 14: Build shown in the picture, the redstone torch is your output.
rg.password.text21: STEP 15: Cover it with any of your chosen opaque blocks.
rg.password.text22: STEP 16: Place 2 iron door at the top of 2 redstone torch.
rg.password.text23: STEP 17: Build a frame of your iron door.
rg.password.text24: Your password door is done, your door is close because iron door is the last thing you place so the door doesn't update with redstone torch below. Try to ON then OFF or OFF then ON one of the levers and your door will open.
rg.password.text25: Turn OFF all the levers to make your password isn't visible.
rg.password.text26: You can now cover redstone components and start building your house.
rg.itemFrameLock.text0: Item Frame Lock is a redstone mechanism that uses the combination pattern of item frame for door locking.
rg.itemFrameLock.text1: STEP 1: Build a wall and place item frame (must place 1 block away to each other) and set your combination pattern. You can place as many item frame as you want.
rg.itemFrameLock.text2: STEP 2: Place redstone comparator on back of each item frame facing away from item frames.
rg.itemFrameLock.text3: Comparators may produce different redstone power level depending on placement of item in item frame.
rg.itemFrameLock.text4: STEP 3: Place a line of redstone dust on each of comparators according to their power level. For example if your comparator produce redstone power level 6 place 6 line of redstone dust. Then place redstone torch on each end just like picture below.
rg.itemFrameLock.text5: §oTip: To check if you're doing right place redstone connected to the last redstone, if it's off that means you're doing right.
rg.itemFrameLock.text6: STEP 4: At the end of your redstone line build like shown below. Again to check if you're doing right check the redstone dust (or repeater) place in slab, if it's off you're doing right.
rg.itemFrameLock.text7: STEP 5: Do it for each of your line of redstone dust.
rg.itemFrameLock.text8: STEP 6: Connect all of the output just like shown below. This is your ouput for this combination lock.
rg.itemFrameLock.text9: STEP 7: Now for building a door, build like shown in the picture. This example is for double door, removed the other if you need single door only, you can also use any method you prefer for triggering your door.
rg.itemFrameLock.text10: STEP 8: Now connect ouput of your combination lock to where your door will be.
rg.itemFrameLock.text11: STEP 9: On the door part you can now place iron door, cover redstone components and you're all set.
rg.rsLatch.text0: A RS latch has separate control lines to set (turn on) or reset (turn off) the latch. Many also have dual outputs. The oldest form of RS latch in Minecraft is the RS-NOR latch, which forms the heart of many other latch and flip-flop designs.
rg.rsLatch.text1: Setting both inouts high simultaneously is a §bforbidden§r condition, generally something to avoid. In the truth table, S=1, R=1 breaks the inverse relationship between Q and Qi. If this happens, the player will get §eundefined behavior§r - various designs can be different things, and especially Q and Qi can be high or low at the same time. If the forbidden state is co-opted to §otoggle§r the output, the circuit becomes a JK latch, described in its own section. Of there is instead a third input which toggles the output, the circuit becomes an §eRST latch§r.
rg.rsLatch.text2: Any RS latch with dual outputs is functionally symmetrical: pulsing each input turns on "its" output, and turns off the other one. Thus R and S are interchangeable, if the outputs is swapped: Which input players pick as S chooses which of the outputs is Q, then the other input will be R and the other output will be Qi. (If the original circuit only had a Q output, then swapping the inputs will turn it into Qi.) In several designs (A, B, C, D, E, F, I) the functional symmetry is reflected by the circuit's physical symmetry, with each input energizing the torch it leads to, while turning off the other.
rg.rsLatch.text3: RS latches can be built in a number of ways:
rg.rsLatch.text4: -Two NOR gates can be linked so that whichever is lit, the other will be off. The RS NOR latch is the "original" RS latch, and still among the smallest memory devices that can be made in vanilla Minecraft. While they can be built with just torches and redstone dust, repeaters can also be used. Many of these designs have "duplex I/O" - the same locations can be used to read or set the latch state.
rg.rsLatch.text5: -It is also possible to construct an RS NAND latch, using NAND gates instead of NOR gates. These will be larger and more complex than an RS NOR latch, but may be useful for specialized purposes. Their inputs are inverted (see below for details).
rg.rsLatch.text6: -Other RS latches can be created by fitting an "input sustaining circuit" with a reset switch, say by adding a pair of NOT gates or a piston, placed so as to interrupt the circuit when triggered. Such a construction can be nearly as compact as an RS NOR latch (and often with better I/O isolation and/or timing), but they will usually not have a natural Qi output.
rg.rsLatch.text7: -Other devices can also be involved. Pistons can be used to physically toggle a block's location, while hoppers or droppers can pass around an item entity. These circuits can be very fast and small, with little redstone dust.
rg.rsLatch.text8: Designs §bA§r and §bB§r are the most fundamental RS-NOR latches. In both cases, their inputs and outputs are "duplex" -the latch state can be read (Q) or set (S) on one side of the circuit, while on the other side, the latch can be reset (R), or the inverse output read (Qi). If separate lines for input and output are needed, opposite ends of §bB§r can be used, or §bA§r can be elaborated into §bA'§r with separate locations for all four lines.
rg.dLatch.text0: A D latch has a data input and a clock input. When the clock is triggered, the data input is copied to the output, then held until the clock is triggered again.
rg.jkLatch.text0: A JK latch has three inputs: A clock input, and the jump and kill inputs. When the clock is triggered, the latch's output can be set, reset, toggled, or left as is, depending on the combination of J and K. While these are common in real-world electronics, in §oMinecraft§r they tend to be bulky and impractical — most players would use an SRT latch instead
rg.TflipFlop.text0: The letter "T" is for "toggles". Whenever the input changes from OFF to ON, the output will toggle its state. A useful way to use T flip-flops in Minecraft could, for example, be a button connected to the input. When you press the button the output toggles and does not toggle back when the button pops out. Basically it makes the button work as lever.
rg.TflipFlop.text1: These examples is a repeater locking method, since it uses a repeater they are completely silent. These example work the same but with different properties.
rg.TflipFlop.text7: Redstone Torch is the output. Dropper at the bottom is facing upward, dropper at top facing at comparator and hopper is connected at lower dropper. Once built, place a single item inside of either containers and it will work as a T Flip-flop, with the item cycling between the two droppers.
rg.TflipFlop.text8: In the picture above the item is in lower dropper if input is powered, the repeater will power the two dropper causing lower dropper to transfer item at the top dropper and make comparator to turn on and output will off. If it's powered again the dropper throw item and hopper will take it and bring back at bottom dropper causing the comparator turn to off and output is on.
rg.TflipFlop.text12: §bVariation§r: Redstone torch can replace with repeater or redstone dust, if redstone dust is used it only send an output power level 1. Repeater can replace with comparator or observer as long as it powers the two dropper, you can also place redstone dust on top of dropper and make it input.
rg.itemElevator.text0: Item Elevator is a mechanism which is use to automatically transfer your items from bottom to go up.
rg.itemElevator.text1: STEP 1: Dig a hole with 3 length, 4 width and 1 block depth.
rg.itemElevator.text2: STEP 2: On the corner of the hole place a dropper facing upward, how tall you want.
rg.itemElevator.text3: STEP 3: Then place a chest on top of dropper.
rg.itemElevator.text4: STEP 4: Dig 2 block to the front of dropper.
rg.itemElevator.text5: STEP 5: Then place a hopper connected to lower dropper.
rg.itemElevator.text6: STEP 6: Then place a chest in top of hopper.
rg.itemElevator.text8: STEP 8: Place an alternatiing block start from where repeater is facing, going to the top.
rg.itemElevator.text9: STEP 9: Then place an alternating redstone torch going to the top. Now the item Elevator is done.
rg.itemElevator.text10: STEP 10: You can now build a wall to cover redstone components. Store item/s in lower chest and it will automatically transfer to top chest.
rg.elevator.text0: Elevator is a redstone mechanism that allow player or mob to transfer from bottom to top or from top to bottom.
rg.elevator.text1: The step by step tutorial for building redstone elevator is not yet currently finished, because it has a lot of steps. You can watch it in my channel for tutorial in building this redstone elevator. The tutorial in this guide for building elevator will be added soon.
rg.elevator.text2: To watch the video search my channel on YouTube "Vechrozilator" then go to playlist redstone creation and find it or simply search Vechrozilator's elevator.
rg.elevator.text3: You can visit this link: https://youtu.be/o4krM-8HVDs
rg.hiddenDoor.text0: This mechanism makes your room/house hidden, the door or entrance to your room/house is hidden you can use to protect your house from other players or hide something from others.
rg.hiddenDoor.text1: Jeb door is a hidden room in wall that uses a sticky piston to move a block and create a path to your entrance.
rg.hiddenDoor.text2: STEP 1: Build a frame of door then sticky pistons.
rg.hiddenDoor.text3: STEP 2: Place another sticky piston in front of sticky piston then a block.
rg.hiddenDoor.text4: STEP 3: Build a wall, this will be your path to go inside of your hidden room.
rg.hiddenDoor.text5: STEP 4: Place down a redstone wire this is your input.
rg.hiddenDoor.text6: STEP 5: Continue wiring going to the next sticky piston with 3 ticks of repeater.
rg.hiddenDoor.text7: STEP 6: Now cover the redstone components place lever in the left side at center and flicked it to close door.
rg.hiddenDoor.text8: If you want input isn't visible you can make a hidden input contraption, see hidden input section.
rg.hiddenDoor.text9: STEP 1: Dig a hole with 5 width 8 length and 3 depth
rg.hiddenDoor.text10: STEP 2: Place a blocks just like in the picture below for redstone wiring.
rg.hiddenDoor.text11: STEP 3: Now place down redstone wire, redstone wire on center is your input.
rg.hiddenDoor.text12: STEP 4: Place a 2x2 sticky piston facing each other.
rg.hiddenDoor.text13: STEP 5: Place another sticky piston in front of sticky piston in both side.
rg.hiddenDoor.text14: STEP 6: Then place a block in front of sticky piston l, these blocks is your door.
rg.hiddenDoor.text15: STEP 7: Build a frame of your door.
rg.hiddenDoor.text16: STEP 8: At the back, build an upwiring circuit with glass going to the top, make sure redstone dust is directly at piston below.
rg.hiddenDoor.text17: STEP 9: Cover all of the redstone components, set up your input try to activate input to see how it work. You can build hidden input see "Hidden Input" section for tutorial.
rg.hiddenDoor.text18: For more hidden room visit my channel and see §6Hidden Room Ideas§r playlist. This playlist is all about building hidden room.
rg.pistonDoor.text0: STEP 1: Place a sticky piston with blocks of your choice like shown below
rg.pistonDoor.text1: STEP 2: Connect them using redstone dust above them.
rg.pistonDoor.text2: STEP 3: Then finally build a wall to cover the redstone components in both side. In any those redstone dust can be your input.
rg.castleGate.text0: STEP 1: Build an upward double piston extender with 4 wide. In case you don't know how to build or how it work see piston extender section under contraption category.
rg.castleGate.text1: STEP 2: Place a 4 x 4 Fences directly at sticky piston.
rg.castleGate.text2: STEP 3: Build a frame for your fences and place 2 rows of pistons that facing downward.
rg.castleGate.text3: STEP 4: Power the input of your piston extender to extend the fence and push it upward.
rg.castleGate.text4: STEP 5: Build a frame again like shown in the picture below, also at the back.
rg.castleGate.text5: STEP 6: On top of it build this, this is back view, but it doesn't matter if you do it in either front or back.
rg.castleGate.text6: STEP 7: On its side build a torch tower like show in the picture.
rg.castleGate.text7: STEP 8: Now at bottom part build this like shown below, the red block represent as your input. (In front of lower observer has repeater with 4 ticks)
rg.lavaDoor.text0: Lava Door is a mechanism where it uses lava as barrier of the door. When lava is about to flow and closes the door it will retract piston below the ground so there's a hole for lava to catch it. Then will extend piston after lava disappear.
rg.lavaDoor.text1: STEP 1: Dig a hole with 2 block wide 4 length and 2 block depth. Then place 3 sticky piston facing upward with a redstone dust and redstone torch in side of it like what shown in the picture. This use to catch lava
rg.lavaDoor.text2: STEP 2: On the right side of the hole dig another hole. 2 more blocks in front, 3 blocks at the back, with 5 blocks width and 2 blocks depth.
rg.lavaDoor.text3: STEP 3: Build Ethonian Hopper Clock on the side of hole.
rg.lavaDoor.text4: STEP 4: Place a block in front of hopper with redstone torch attached to both side and repeater facing to it then another block in back of repeater with redstone on top. This will be the input of ethonian hopper clock.
rg.lavaDoor.text5: STEP 5: Put any 30 items inside the hopper.
rg.lavaDoor.text6: STEP 6: Dig a hole again like shown in the picture, it's going to redstone torch to the sticky piston from redstone torch in input of ethonian hopper clock.
rg.lavaDoor.text7: STEP 7: Place down redstone dust in this hole including on top of block near the sticky piston. Place a block where redstone dust attempt to connect above to separate the signal.
rg.lavaDoor.text8: STEP 8: Build a farme of door, its 7 block high including a block submerged in the ground. It is require that you have atleast 1 block submerged in the ground correspond to sticky piston, so when sticky piston is retracted lava will not spill in that hole.
rg.lavaDoor.text9: STEP 9: Continue building the frame of door. Leave a hole in center.
rg.lavaDoor.text10: STEP 10: Cover the floor of door with your chosen block that couldn't burn. As you see in the picture in the middle is 1 block below because it's attached to sticky piston.
rg.lavaDoor.text11: STEP 11: At the top of door place dispenser in the hole facing down with bucket of lava in each of dispenser.
rg.lavaDoor.text12: STEP 12: At the side of door, build a thing like this. This will be your input.
rg.lavaDoor.text13: STEP 13: On the block of input place a repeater facing away to it then build a T-Flip Flop next to it. Put one item in lower dropper. It is required that item is placed in lower dropper otherwise the lava and retracting of piston will not met a certain condition we wanted.
rg.lavaDoor.text14: STEP 14: Place redstone torch attached to block of output of T-Flip Flop then a redstone dust below connected to repeater.
rg.lavaDoor.text15: STEP 15: From your input connect it to dispenser above with torch tower.
rg.lavaDoor.text16: STEP 16: Now it's done! Design your door, replace ground with blocks of your choice.
rg.lavaDoor.text17: STEP 17: Now place a button in front and back of the door. Click the button to close the door with lava.
rg.lavaDoor.note: §oNOTE: Don't click button too fast and don't click while lava is flowing because everything is well timed, this may not cause error to contraptions but may cause lava to spread on ground. Also, after you close the door don't immediately open because lava is slower to flow when disappearing, at that moment items in ethonian hopper clock is still transferring so after it closes wait another few seconds before you open it again.
rg.otherGuides.text0: Looking for more guides like this? There are more guide like this that teaches you with different topic about in Minecraft download these guides you want only at MCPEDL, listed below.
rg.otherGuides.text1: Brewing is the process of creating potions, splash potions and lingering potions by adding various ingredients to water bottles in a brewing stand. This guide was made in order to help you how to brew potions in Minecraft, it can also help you when forget some recipes of potions.
rg.otherGuides.text2: This Guide is already available at MCPEDL.
rg.otherGuides.text3: This guide explains the different crafting stations, new items in the Chemistry Resource Pack and how to craft products by combining compounds with Minecraft items to make helium balloons, glowsticks, bleach, super fertilizer, underwater torches and more.
rg.otherGuides.text4: Banners, are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes. This guide will teach you on how to customize your banner, adding layers in Banner to make your own banner design
rg.otherGuides.text5: The Guides that are listed below are guides that I plan to make wait them to be released only at MCPEDL.
rg.otherGuides.text6: Command Guide - This guide is for teaching you how every command work and how to use them in this guide it's also teach you how do Command Block work and how to use them.
rg.otherGuides.text7: Noteblock Guide - Note block allows you to create music using a lot of this blocks, learn how it work, learn notes of note block and create your own music.
rg.otherGuides.text8: Fireworks Guide - Fireworks can modify how it looks like when it explode in air, in this guides it will help you to modify the explosion design of your fireworks.

otherResources.description.text: Also try other Resources that I was created. Texture pack, Add-on and Minigame Maps. All available at mcpedl.com
otherResources.workingTV.text: A working TV that is not an enitity but rather it's a block, this TV has higher resolution and higher frames thus the GIF will smoothly play on TV.
otherResources.camouflageDoor.text: This addon added different custom doors and custom trapdoors with vanilla blocks texture to make a camouflage door & trapdoor, so you can easily make a hidden room with these doors. There are variety of doors to choose so you can hide your base in any environment.
otherResources.ghostBlock.text: Have you ever wanted to pass through wall to make hidden room? or through floor to make easy trap? Then this addon is for you. This addon convert normal blocks into ghost block so you can able to pass through it, hide in it or make a flawless trap using it.
otherResources.modernBlocks.text: Make your world looks more modern, build and design your home, buildings, offices, bedroom, wardrobe and any other structures with these new decorative modern blocks. Craft modern furnitures with different variations, tiles with different variations and each variation consist of different pattern, build roads with all things you'll need and much more!
otherResources.uncraftable.text: Un-Craftable is an addon that added new crafting recipes for those all items and blocks that you can't craft such as Totem, Saddle, Horse Armours, Saplings, Obsidian, Grass Blocks, Podzol etc. and also you can craft unobtainable blocks such as Bedrock, Mob Spawner, End Portal Frame, Spawn Eggs, Chemistry Tables and even creative blocks such as Command Block, barrier, border etc.
otherResources.simplePack.text: Simple Pack brings a simple, smooth and clean textures to blocks, items and mobs. Also have animation in some blocks.
otherResources.trollParkour.text: A Parkour game with a new twist were there a lot of fake platform, find the right way with trial and error method.
otherResources.escapeRoom.text: You've been locked up in a strange room, you need constantly observe, think, guess, inference, to guess the word and escape in this strange room.
otherResources.4blocks1word.text: A Minigame map which was based on 4 pics 1 word game, guess the word by looking at 4 blocks and rearranging and picking letters to form a word.
otherResources.15waystodie.text: A Minigame map which your goal is to kill yourself, solve puzzles and find a way how would you kill yourself.
otherResources.copyTheBanner.text: Test your skill in designing the banner how good is you, can you copy all of the banner designs?
